.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Field extends Java.Lang.Reflect.AccessibleObject implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.Lang.Reflect.IMember, class System.IDisposable
type Field = class inherit AccessibleObject interface IMember interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: A Field provides information about, and dynamic access to, a single field of a class or an interface.

remarks.para: A Field provides information about, and dynamic access to, a single field of a class or an interface. The reflected field may be a class (static) field or an instance field.
A Field permits widening conversions to occur during a get or set access operation, but throws an IllegalArgumentException if a narrowing conversion would occur.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.property instance class Java.Lang.Reflect.IType GenericType
member this.GenericType : Java.Lang.Reflect.IType

Docs.summary: Returns a Type object that represents the declared type for the field represented by this Field object.
Docs.value: a Type object that represents the declared type for the field represented by this Field object

remarks.para: Returns a Type object that represents the declared type for the field represented by this Field object.
If the Type is a parameterized type, the Type object returned must accurately reflect the actual type parameters used in the source code.
If the type of the underlying field is a type variable or a parameterized type, it is created. Otherwise, it is resolved.
Added in 1.5.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the generic field signature is invalid
if the generic type points to a missing type
if the generic type points to a type that cannot be instantiated for some reason

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function Get (obj As Object) As Object
public: Java::Lang::Object ^ Get(Java::Lang::Object ^ obj);
public Java.Lang.Object? Get (Java.Lang.Object? obj);
.method public hidebysig instance class Java.Lang.Object Get(class Java.Lang.Object obj) cil managed
member this.Get : Java.Lang.Object -> Java.Lang.Object

Docs.param: object from which the represented field's value is to be extracted
Docs.summary: Returns the value of the field represented by this Field, on the specified object.
Docs.returns: the value of the represented field in object obj; primitive values are wrapped in an appropriate object before being returned

remarks.para: Returns the value of the field represented by this Field, on the specified object. The value is automatically wrapped in an object if it has a primitive type.
The underlying field's value is obtained as follows:
If the underlying field is a static field, the obj argument is ignored; it may be null.

Otherwise, the underlying field is an instance field. If the specified obj argument is null, the method throws a NullPointerException. If the specified object is not an instance of the class or interface declaring the underlying field, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.

If this Field object is enforcing Java language access control, and the underlying field is inaccessible, the method throws an IllegalAccessException. If the underlying field is static, the class that declared the field is initialized if it has not already been initialized.

Otherwise, the value is retrieved from the underlying instance or static field. If the field has a primitive type, the value is wrapped in an object before being returned, otherwise it is returned as is.
If the field is hidden in the type of obj, the field's value is obtained according to the preceding rules.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the object is null and the field is non-static
if the object is not compatible with the declaring class
if this field is not accessible

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub Set (obj As Object, value As Object)
public: void Set(Java::Lang::Object ^ obj, Java::Lang::Object ^ value);
public void Set (Java.Lang.Object? obj, Java.Lang.Object? value);
.method public hidebysig instance void Set(class Java.Lang.Object obj, class Java.Lang.Object value) cil managed
member this.Set : Java.Lang.Object * Java.Lang.Object -> unit

Docs.param: the object whose field should be modified
the new value for the field of obj being modified
Docs.summary: Sets the field represented by this Field object on the specified object argument to the specified new value.

remarks.para: Sets the field represented by this Field object on the specified object argument to the specified new value. The new value is automatically unwrapped if the underlying field has a primitive type.
The operation proceeds as follows:
If the underlying field is static, the obj argument is ignored; it may be null.

Otherwise the underlying field is an instance field. If the specified object argument is null, the method throws a NullPointerException. If the specified object argument is not an instance of the class or interface declaring the underlying field, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.
If this Field object is enforcing Java language access control, and the underlying field is inaccessible, the method throws an IllegalAccessException.

If the underlying field is final, this Field object has write access if and only if the following conditions are met:
  • #setAccessible(boolean) setAccessible(true) has succeeded for this Field object;
  • the field is non-static; and
  • the field's declaring class is not a Class#isRecord() record class.
If any of the above checks is not met, this method throws an IllegalAccessException.

Setting a final field in this way is meaningful only during deserialization or reconstruction of instances of classes with blank final fields, before they are made available for access by other parts of a program. Use in any other context may have unpredictable effects, including cases in which other parts of a program continue to use the original value of this field.

If the underlying field is of a primitive type, an unwrapping conversion is attempted to convert the new value to a value of a primitive type. If this attempt fails, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.
If, after possible unwrapping, the new value cannot be converted to the type of the underlying field by an identity or widening conversion, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.
If the underlying field is static, the class that declared the field is initialized if it has not already been initialized.
The field is set to the possibly unwrapped and widened new value.
If the field is hidden in the type of obj, the field's value is set according to the preceding rules.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the object is null and the field is non-static
if the object is not compatible with the declaring class
if this field is not accessible

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function ToGenericString () As String
public: System::String ^ ToGenericString();
public string ToGenericString ();
.method public hidebysig instance string ToGenericString() cil managed
member this.ToGenericString : unit -> string

Docs.summary: Returns a string describing this Field, including its generic type.
Docs.returns: a string describing this Field, including its generic type

remarks.para: Returns a string describing this Field, including its generic type. The format is the access modifiers for the field, if any, followed by the generic field type, followed by a space, followed by the fully-qualified name of the class declaring the field, followed by a period, followed by the name of the field.

The modifiers are placed in canonical order as specified by "The Java Language Specification". This is public, protected or private first, and then other modifiers in the following order: static, final, transient, volatile.
Added in 1.5.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
